## Description {#details}

A debug info location.

This class is a wrapper around a tracking reference to an <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dilocation">DILocation</a></em> pointer.

To avoid extra includes, <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/debugloc">DebugLoc</a></em> doubles the <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dilocation">DILocation</a></em> API with a one based on relatively opaque <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">MDNode</a></em> pointers.

Definition at line 33 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debugloc-h">DebugLoc.h</a>.

### DebugLoc() {#a274fed1b1b0bad2f68057a400b5cf738}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>DebugLoc::DebugLoc (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">MDNode</a> &#42; N)</>}
  labels = {["explicit"]}>
Construct from an <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">MDNode</a></em>.

Note: if <code>N</code> is not an <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dilocation">DILocation</a></em>, a verifier check will fail, and accessors will crash. However, construction from other nodes is supported in order to handle forward references when reading textual IR.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debugloc-h/#l00048">48</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debugloc-h">DebugLoc.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/debugloc-cpp/#l00018">18</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/debugloc-cpp">DebugLoc.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

## Public Operators

### operator bool() {#ad3d3e352271b660741f403e60c732b71}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="llvm::DebugLoc::operator bool () const"
  labels = {["inline", "explicit"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> for null.

<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> for null in a way that is safe with broken debug info. Unlike the conversion to <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dilocation">DILocation</a></code>, this doesn&#39;t require that <code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loc">Loc</a></code> is of the right type. Important for cases like <em><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9b2f025559a0b80366b74285cf25c01e">llvm::StripDebugInfo()</a></em> and <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#a565f546ad95bd3a9bbe9a1e5040803f0">Instruction::hasMetadata()</a></em>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debugloc-h/#l00066">66</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debugloc-h">DebugLoc.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### hasTrivialDestructor() {#a6fb007484ca0f8415aaa6ef6c1677c5f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::DebugLoc::hasTrivialDestructor () const"
